questions.question: Which is not represented by the seven points of the crown of the Statue of Liberty according to the text?

choices.answer: How liberty enlightens the world
The sun
The seven continents
The seven days of creation

questions.question: Information in the second paragraph is mainly organized using which text structure?

choices.answer: Spatial order
order of importance
chronological order
cause and effect

questions.question: Which best expressed the main idea of the 3rd paragraph?

choices.answer: France assisted the US in the Revolutionary War
The US was once a colony of Great Britain
The statue was a joint effort between France and the U.S.
The statue of liberty was dedicated 100 years after US became independent

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?

choices.answer: The tablet that the Statue of Liberty holds is 23 feet
The pedestal underneath the Statue of Liberty is 305 ft tall
The Statue of Liberty's waist size is 35 feet
The Statue of Liberty is over 151 feet tall

questions.question: Which is not a reason why people criticized the Statue of Liberty during its construction?

choices.answer: The statue should have been bigger
The statue should have been built by an American
France should have paid for the statue and the pedestal
America shouldn't spend money on a statue during a depression

questions.question: Which best expresses the author's purpose in writing the last paragraph?

choices.answer: To describe what a depression is
To show that some people did not think very highly of the French
To argue why the Statue of Liberty was a good investment
To explain why some people were against building the statue

questions.question: Which of the following is an opinion?

choices.answer: The S.O.L. cost a tremendous amount of money to build
The S.O.L. was sculpted by Frederic Auguste Bartholdi
The S.O.L. is over 151 feet tall
The S.O.L. may sway 3 inches on a windy day

questions.question: Which of the following statements is false?

choices.answer: The guy who build the Eiffel Tower also designed the S.O.L.
The Eiffel Tower was a gift to the Americans from the people of France
The S.O.L. is located on federal property
Bartholdi got permission from both the French and US to build the statue

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the ways the Bartholdi contributed to the statue?

choices.answer: He designed the interior of the statue.
He gained approval for the project from the US and from France
He sculpted the exterior of the statue
He gained financing to complete the project from France.

questions.question: Which best expresses the author's purpose in writing this text?

choices.answer: To persuade people to visit the Statue of Liberty
To inform readers with interesting facts about the Statue of Liberty
To entertain readers with stories about the construction of the S.O.L.
To describe the appearance of the Statue of Liberty
